channel.title: FINAL Devolution 2.7 (THE END)
channel.description:
[b] FINAL Devolution 2.7 The End.[/b]
Ok everyone, i was not sure if i were going to release this But.. i decided to give one last present so to speak.
Server Background: this server was made 100% from Devolution 7.0. if anyone reading this had played it you would know how much time has actually gone into this server.
Previous version: 2.6 was suppose to be a good release only i had never got to test combat thoroughly and what do you know! i had messed up a feature which let you attack people lower than you.
FEATURES
full heavy duty npc combat, includes. 3 different npc types. (Melee, Ranged and Magic)
Melee combat( npcs will follow and attack at the same time!, and they will not attack from over 2 squares away (server side not client side) they have delayed attacks which can be changed for each separate npc even if they use the same combat type.)
Ranged combat( npcs will follow if they are not within 4 squares of their attacker however then can still attack from 8 squares apart thus making them effective.)
Magic combat( runs off the same base as magic but if slightly more advanced. npcs can have there own separate attacks, projectiles, GFX, etc when ranging only needs to use the projectile method. all timers can be adjusted via the configuration file located in "server/npcs/combat/config/npcConfig.cfg")
NPC Combat dumbed down. all spells, hit delays, gfxs, aggressive types, aggressive distances etc are all loaded via the configuration file, making adding new npcs fast and easy. you guys are lucky i decided to add this feature as there use to be a method for every single type which was complicated and a hassel to add things into.
Aggressive npcs, yep. you can set npcs to aggressive in npcConfig.cfg by adding a 1 to correct place (read the file and you will see) also you can add there distance they will start running to attack you from npcConfig.cfg.
pictures say 1000 words huh? how many does a video say then? (please advise this video contains EXTREME ownage not recommended for jealous pricks). http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jOSbtQz8tjw
PVP COMBAT update well in 2.6 there was a bug which lead to disconnections. not to worry it was not a big issue, it was caused from players clicking people not in the level requirement and the method which was made correctly just had missed a return statement which i believe someone else had found, so therefore the players attack continued to run with misleading information. I have added a new class called defenceAnimations, this will now provide a nice defending emote system depending on the items wielded, thanks for deadly uzi for the animation ids.
have fun. http://uppit.com/v/zvjv968h

item.title: FINAL Devolution 2.7 (THE END)
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

I am sorry to ruin your days guys. But this is not as amazing as you all seem to think. I used this for my The Game source and after just a few days of hosting I had to give up. Delta is more stable than this. Everysingle day I would check to see if still running every single day it would be nulling. I would fix the issue. Everysingle day a new one would occur. Not to mention when initially being used to create my source I had to fix sooo many things.

E.g:
Autocasting - did not work on npcs.
Trading - did not work.
Following - did not work.
And the biggest problem of all. His skills. Almost all of the skills he wrote had serious glitches or had been done in a silly way.

Now I am not saying Killamess did a bad job. No he is one of the best people on this website. BUT he needs to test his work more thoroughly before releasing things.

Read full topic

item.title: FINAL Devolution 2.7 (THE END)
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

I really think this should be stickied if only for use as an example as to how sources should be set out. While reading it (it’s like reading harry potter you just can’t put it down) you just can’t stop thinking that the whole time he was making it it was so anybody could use it. Everything is set out for convenience. He has put all the ints, booleans and strings that leechers will need to change into one file it’s just lovely.

Read full topic
